reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good novel
reviews.reviewText: I practice yoga so the language of the novel was familiar. It made me want to highlight and share so many insights about the power of words, or thought creates reality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I highly recommend this book!
reviews.reviewText: Great book! I loved the story and the way the author expressed it. I was immediately drawn in by the two main characters, craving to know how they and their relationship would develop. I had this curiosity while at the same time trying to figure out what my own special power is!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved this book . Highly recommend
reviews.reviewText: Great story. Loved the characters. Looking forward to more books by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A gentle touch of fate
reviews.reviewText: This is a book that every person wants to go through. Can you imagine that one day, when you think nothing new and significant will happen in your life and you can only settle for the mundane, someone appears and has a solution? Well, it's nothing like the magic wand - you must wake up first and do something about it. But that first nudge is always the most important one. Michael does that for Sheera.Sheera is a single mother. She keeps telling herself that she doesn't need a father for her child. She can make it. At the same time, she wants a stable relationship and a job without stress. She works at a TV station and her son loves hearing about what new shows are coming on TV.Sheera thinks she has it all, but she just isn't happy. That is the perfect time for Michael to appear in her life.I'm not a great fan of characters writing letters to each other (emails in this case). I don't like novels consisting of letters/emails. But Sheera has a gentle touch when she writes her part, and I like how Michael is confident. You will notice two different styles throughout those emails, no worries. I liked the one when Michael was describing what he was doing in the army.

reviews.reviewerName: We aren’t always aware of the fact that every person is in a constant search of his (or her) source of power in the world, from the moment we’re born. But knowing what your true gift is (which is also your true power) is not so easy… I love the way this idea was presented in the story.
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A fascinating book
reviews.reviewText: We aren’t always aware of the fact that every person is in a constant search of his (or her) source of power in the world, from the moment we’re born. But knowing what your true gift is (which is also your true power) is not so easy… I love the way this idea was presented in the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A well-crafted contemporary romantic drama.
reviews.reviewText: "Words Apart" by Lilac Sigan unfolds as a mesmerizing drama, delving into the intricate realms of love, self-discovery, and the profound impact of storytelling. Sheera Leitner, a resilient single mom navigating the challenges of her TV career, becomes the focal point of this narrative. At forty, she grapples with the fear of never finding a fulfilling relationship, finding solace in the stability provided by her demanding profession.Enter Michael, a mysterious figure who becomes a pivotal force in Sheera's life. Michael's captivating personality extends a tempting proposition to Sheera, offering her a journey of self-exploration beyond her imagination. Despite initial hesitations, the sharp wit and surprisingly sensitive soul of Michael draw Sheera into an enchanting and, at times, terrifying world. Their transformative odyssey unfolds through a private online journal, a shared space where Sheera meticulously chronicles their experiences.As the narrative progresses letter by letter, word by word, ordinary choices take on extraordinary meanings. Lilac Sigan skillfully weaves a tale where hidden strengths emerge from past secrets, and desires manifest in unexpected ways. The dynamics of Sheera's old and new worlds collide, compelling her to confront preconceived notions about herself, Michael, and the potent influence of words.Intricately exploring themes of personal growth, the complexities of human connection, and the empowering dynamics of self-expression, "Words Apart" offers a poignant reading experience. Lilac Sigan's narrative not only captivates readers with its exploration of love and self-discovery but also underscores the life-changing gift embedded in the act of storytelling.With its exploration of personal growth, hidden strengths, and the dynamics of human connection, "Words Apart" offers a poignant and empowering reading experience that comes highly recommended. I voluntarily reviewed a complimentary copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: "Words Apart" by Lilac Sigan is a captivating novel that delves into the complexities of human relationships and the power of communication. Set in a richly drawn world, the story follows the intertwined lives of characters navigating love, loss, and longing. Sigan's prose is lyrical and evocative, drawing readers into the emotional landscapes of her characters with sensitivity and depth. As the narrative unfolds, themes of connection and misunderstanding emerge, challenging readers to reflect on the ways in which words can both unite and divide us. With its compelling storytelling and thought-provoking themes, "Words Apart" is a poignant exploration of the intricate tapestry of human connection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Take some quiet time and read this book
reviews.reviewText: "Instead of using your power, you live alongside it, it’s like you drive on two parallel roads that never meet”.When Michael said this to Sheera it grabbed me in the stomach, and I felt like sending this quote to so many people I know… This book has to be read quietly, and it captivates you more and more as you read.
